result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Michael Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn Michael Hopkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn Michael Hopkins was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Upon defendant's request to refuse probation, Court withdraws probation and sentences.

Notice and Motion to Decline Probation and Proceed to Sentencing pursuant to Law

Shawn Michael Hopkins, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Defendant refuses probation.  Parties sentence recommendation.
Court withdraws probation and sentences.  Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
